title: Game-Based Programming Learning Design: Strengthening Mathematical Problem-Solving Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic programming syntax (variables, conditionals, loops) and high school-level mathematics knowledge
context.additional_context: Emphasis on collaborative problem-solving activities using game platforms in online real-time environments

learning_goals: Learners can apply mathematical logic (set theory, permutations and combinations) with 80% accuracy when designing algorithms in a game-based environment.
Learners can describe problem-solving strategies in three stages (analysis-implementation-verification) through the level design analysis of programming games.
Learners can identify and correct three or more logical errors in in-game code implementation through a peer assessment system.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
